name: Against Malaria Foundation
mission: We fund and provide long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) to protect those at risk from malaria.
theoryOfChange: By providing LLINs (input) and ensuring their use through monitoring (process), malaria transmission is prevented, leading to reduced illness and mortality (outcome).

evaluationSources: The Life You Can Save - Top Rated 2012 to 2025
Giving What We Can - Top Rated 2012 to 2025

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a GMG score of 66/100 due to its extraordinary financial efficiency and evidence-based impact, though its alignment score is moderated by a low donor fit for specific religious giving profiles.
areas_for_improvement: Limited alignment for donors specifically seeking Muslim-led or community-specific charitable structures.
Heavy reliance on a single intervention type (LLINs) within the broader scope of global health.

dimension_explanations.alignment: While the cause of malaria prevention is a high-urgency global health priority, the organization has a low donor fit for those seeking specific cultural or religious alignment [1]. It is recognized as a sadaqah-eligible charity for general voluntary giving [7].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high impact through a capacity-building model that delivers protection at a low cost per beneficiary [1]. Its effectiveness is supported by detailed technical reports and smartphone-based monitoring that verify net hanging rates and household coverage [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) provides life-saving protection against malaria by funding and distributing long-lasting insecticidal nets to at-risk populations.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 100.0%, ensuring all public donations go directly to net programs [1][2].
Rigorous post-distribution monitoring (PDCU) to track net usage, hanging status, and physical condition [4][6].
High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent to raise every $1 [1].
baseline_narrative.summary: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) focuses on the procurement and distribution of long-lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) to prevent the spread of malaria [3]. With a total revenue of $62,286,888, the organization maintains a high level of transparency and financial efficiency in its global health operations [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a GMG score of 66/100 due to its extraordinary financial efficiency and evidence-based impact, though its alignment score is moderated by a low donor fit for specific religious giving profiles.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization operates with a <cite id="13">minimal board of 4 members</cite>, which is smaller than the recommended size for an organization of this financial scale.
The charity currently maintains <cite id="14">0.0 months of working capital in working capital</cite>, indicating a lack of traditional liquidity reserves.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards with audited financials and transparent reporting.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The 100% program ratio is possible because private donors cover all overhead, mitigating the risk of zero reserves for public donations.
risk_factors: <cite id="14">Zero months of operating reserves</cite> creates potential sustainability risks
<cite id="13">Small board size</cite> limits organizational oversight
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="13">minimal governance staffing</cite> and a <cite id="14">lack of working capital reserves</cite>.

confidence.data_freshness: Data current as of 2024 tax year and 2025 crawl
confidence.notes: Exceptional transparency in technical reporting allows for high confidence in impact claims.

alignment.explanation: While the cause is urgent, the charity has <cite id="15">low Muslim donor fit</cite> as it is not faith-based, though it serves <cite id="9">Muslim-majority regions</cite> like Guinea and Burkina Faso.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by highlighting specific impacts within <cite id="9">underserved Muslim communities</cite> in its geographic footprint.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust AMF due to its <cite id="10">94.0/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and its <cite id="16">100% independent board</cite>. The organization provides <cite id="12">detailed technical reports</cite> for every distribution campaign.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity could <cite id="13">expand its board size</cite> beyond the current four members to enhance diverse oversight.

impact.explanation: Impact is maximized through a <cite id="3">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a highly efficient <cite id="5">$0.00 fundraising cost</cite>. Their <cite id="6">monitoring surveys</cite> provide verified evidence of net usage.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be further refined by <cite id="17">documenting a clear theory of change</cite> with a formal causal pathway for its capacity-building efforts.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade A - Verified outcomes and external evaluations

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct procurement of nets rather than cash grants to other NGOs

rich_narrative.headline: The Against Malaria Foundation (US) provides life-saving protection against malaria by funding and distributing long-lasting insecticidal nets to at-risk populations.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize rigorous evidence and want to maximize the number of lives protected per dollar through a highly efficient, secular global health intervention.
donor_motivations: Value extreme financial efficiency where 100% of their gift buys nets
Prefer data-heavy reporting and verified impact metrics
Want to address one of the most cost-effective health interventions globally
Are comfortable supporting a secular organization with a proven track record
giving_considerations: Public donations are restricted solely to net procurement
The organization focuses on a single, highly-effective intervention
Reporting is technical and focused on monitoring data rather than storytelling
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill Zakat obligations or those looking for faith-based community development programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade A due to verified outcome tracking, <cite id="19">external evaluation documents</cite>, and rigorous post-distribution monitoring.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: AMF funds and distributes LLINs to at-risk populations, then conducts multi-year monitoring to ensure nets are hung and used, directly reducing malaria transmission and mortality.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that nets are not just delivered but are used correctly to save lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Malaria remains a leading cause of death in sub-Saharan Africa, and AMF's scalable model can absorb significant additional funding for net procurement.
strategic_priorities: Expand LLIN coverage in high-burden regions

peer_comparison.differentiator: AMF's <cite id="3">100.0% program ratio</cite> significantly exceeds the <cite id="18">peer median of 84.6%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Direct healthcare delivery in conflict zones

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> and spends <cite id="5">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in public donations.
AMF conducts <cite id="6">post-distribution check-ups</cite> to verify <cite id="7">net hanging status</cite> and physical condition through household visits.
The charity holds a <cite id="10">94/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.

strengths_deep_dive: The Against Malaria Foundation's operational model is built on radical transparency and cost-effectiveness. By ensuring that <cite id="3">100.0% of public donations go directly to programs</cite>, they achieve a cost-per-beneficiary of approximately $0.18. Their monitoring system is equally robust; for instance, technical reports show they track <cite id="11">nets found in very good condition</cite> versus those with holes categorized from <cite id="12">small to giant</cite>. This level of granular data collection allows for precise impact assessment and ensures that donor funds translate directly into disease prevention in high-burden regions like <cite id="9">Cambodia and Ethiopia</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Against Malaria Foundation (AMF) is a highly specialized global health organization that focuses on the <cite id="1">procurement and distribution of long-lasting insecticidal nets</cite> (LLINs) to prevent malaria. Since its founding in <cite id="2">2003</cite>, AMF has established itself as one of the most efficient charities globally, maintaining a <cite id="3">100.0% program expense ratio</cite> where all public donations are used exclusively to buy nets. In the 2024 tax year, the organization reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $62,286,888</cite>, all of which was derived from contributions. AMF operates with extreme financial leaness, achieving a <cite id="5">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>. Beyond procurement, the organization is distinguished by its <cite id="6">rigorous post-distribution check-ups</cite> (PDCUs), which use smartphone technology to track <cite id="7">net usage and hanging status</cite> at 6, 12, 18, and 24-month intervals. These monitoring efforts ensure that the <cite id="8">624,532 nets distributed in specific campaigns</cite> are actually providing the intended protection. By partnering with local health authorities in countries like <cite id="9">Guinea, Malawi, and South Sudan</cite>, AMF integrates its distributions into national malaria control strategies while maintaining independent oversight of impact data.
